enum.name: MAV_EMERGENCY_ACTION
enum.description: Action to perform in case of emergency.

entry.name: EMERGENCY_ACTION_GO_HOME
entry.description: Return and land at the home position.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CAMERA_CONTROL
entry.description: Controls an on-board camera controller system.
entry.param: Target camera tilt value in degrees: [-90, 90], where -90 stands for looking backward, 0 for full down and 90 for looking straight forward.
Target camera roll value in degrees: [-90, 90], where -90 stands for left and 90 for right.
Target camera yaw value in degrees: [-90, 90], where -90 stands for left and 90 for right.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CAMERA_TRIGGER
entry.description: Changes on-board camera trigger state or triggering mode.
entry.param: Camera trigger state. See MAV_CAMERA_TRIGGER_STATE enum.
Interval between two consequent camera shots in case of serial triggering (CAMERA_TRIGGER_STATE_SERIAL_PHOTO). Value is set in milliseconds.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROUTE_ATTRIBUTES
entry.description: Initializes/changes route parameters, such as safety configuration and emergency actions.
entry.param: Safe altitude. Should be used to return to home location from any other point on the route in case of emergency. Value is always set according to the MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL coordinate system, so, MSL altitude should be expected.
Type of action to perform in case of remote control loss. See MAV_EMERGENCY_ACTION enum.
Type of action to perform in case of GPS signal loss. See MAV_EMERGENCY_ACTION enum.
Type of action to perform in case of low battery. See MAV_EMERGENCY_ACTION enum.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_PANORAMA
entry.description: Makes a panoramic shot. Target system rotates about its yaw axis in order to reach the target angle. Shooting is performed either in continuous (permanent exposure) or discrete (shoot per step) mode. Continuous shooting rotation can still be performed in serial steps with delays.
entry.param: Camera trigger state. Defines panorama mode: continuous exposure (CAMERA_TRIGGER_STATE_ON), or discrete, once per step, shooting (CAMERA_TRIGGER_STATE_SERIAL_PHOTO). Modes for the rest of the MAV_CAMERA_TRIGGER_STATE enum constants are not defined.
Target panorama angle in a range [-360, 360]. If positive the rotation direction should be clockwise, if negative the rotation direction should be counter-clockwise. Set in degrees.
Absolute value of a step angle in case of a discrete shooting. Zero stands for a continuous rotation. Set in degrees.
Delay interval between two steps in milliseconds.
Rotation speed in degrees per second.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND_EX
entry.description: Landing. Item location stands for the point at which system should start a vertical descend to the ground.
entry.param: Acceptance radius of the item location. Maximum distance at which location is considered reached by the system (vehicle). Set in meters.
Rate of descent/vertical speed. Set in meters per second. System can modify o even ignore specified value for safety reasons.
Desired yaw angle as defined by MAV_CMD_NAV_LAND.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF_EX
entry.description: Takeoff. Item location stands for the point at which system should complete takeoff.
entry.param: Acceptance radius of the item location. Maximum distance at which location is considered reached by the system (vehicle). Set in meters.
Rate of climb/vertical speed. Set in meters per second. System can modify o even ignore specified value for safety reasons.
Desired yaw angle as defined by MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_EMERGENCY_LAND
entry.description: Emergency landing. Turn everything off, and fall down.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_RETURN_HOME
entry.description: Return to the home position as set by the route attributes.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT_EX
entry.param: Radius in which the item is accepted as reached, in meters.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_DOWNLINK_CONNECTED
entry.description: Downlink is connected, system is able to push telemetry messages.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_UPLINK_CONNECTED
entry.description: Uplink is connected, system is able to receive mission items and commands.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_HOLD_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Hold command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_CONTINUE_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Continue command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_ARM_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Arm command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_DISARM_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Disarm command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_MODE_AVAILABLE
entry.description: AuroMode command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_MODE_AVAILABLE
entry.description: ManualMode command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_RETURN_HOME_AVAILABLE
entry.description: ReturnHome command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_TAKEOFF_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Takeoff command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_LAND_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Land command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_EMERGENCY_LAND_AVAILABLE
entry.description: EmergencyLand command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_CAMERA_TRIGGER_AVAILABLE
entry.description: CameraTrigger command is supported by the vehicle.

entry.name: MAV_CUSTOM_MODE_FLAG_WAYPOINT_AVAILABLE
entry.description: Waypoint command is supported by the vehicle.

enum.name: MAV_ICAO_ADDRESS_TYPE
enum.description: Type of the ICAO aircraft address.

message.name: MISSION_ITEM_EX
message.description: Message encoding a mission item. Extends common MISSION_ITEM message and provides additional attributes over parameter 8+ fields.
message.field: System that should execute the command.
Component that should execute the command, 0 for all components.
Item sequence number.
Coordinate system of the item position. See MAV_FRAME enum.
Scheduled action for the item. See MAV_CMD enum.
0 for false, 1 for true.
Autocontinue to the next waypoint.
Parameter 1. For NAV items: radius in which the item is accepted as reached, in meters.
Parameter 2. For NAV items: time that the device should stay inside the PARAM1 radius before advancing, in milliseconds.
Parameter 3. For LOITER items: orbit to circle around the item, in meters. If positive the orbit direction should be clockwise, if negative the orbit direction should be counter-clockwise.
Parameter 4. For NAV and LOITER items: yaw orientation in degrees, [0, 360], where 0 stands for North.
Parameter 5. Local frame: x position, global frame: latitude in degrees.
Parameter 6. Local frame: y position, global frame: longitude in degrees.
Parameter 7. Local frame: z position, global frame: altitude in meters.
Parameter 8. Elevation in meters. Present in all positioning commands.
Parameter 9. Altitude origin: MSL height value of the 'zero' relative altitude.

message.name: COMMAND_LONG_EX
message.field: System that should execute the command
Component which should execute the command, 0 for all components
Command, as defined by the MAV_CMD enum.
0: first transmission of this command. 1-255: confirmation transmissions (e.g. for kill command).
Parameter 1, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 2, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 3, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 4, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 5, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 6, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.
Parameter 7, as defined by MAV_CMD enum.

message.name: ADSB_AIRCRAFT_REPORT
message.description: Basic data, collected by the ADS-B IN receiver. Contains positioning attributes of the aircraft. Note, that in general the target of the message is not a Mavlink system itself. Sender (Mavlink system component) represents a receiver and message data is a collected information about surrounding/visible aircrafts, got through the receiver. Nevertheless, system can transmit it's own position in an ADS-B format.
message.field: ICAO identity of the aircraft. Most significant byte of the field denotes an ICAO address type (see MAV_ICAO_ADDRESS_TYPE enum). 3 less significant bytes compose an ICAO address itself.
Aircraft identification string. Not a global/primary identity, but a human-readable label of a flight.
Aircraft WGS-84 position latitude. Set in degrees.
Aircraft WGS-84 position longitude. Set in degrees.

Aircraft MSL altitude. Value can be measured in different ways, depending on the on-board equipment (GNSS- or pressure-altitude) and is not corrected, thus errors of different magnitudes could be induced. Set in meters.
Aircraft heading. Range is from zero (inclusive) to 360 (exclusive), where 0 stands for North and non-zero angle is measured from North in a clockwise direction. Set in degrees.
Ground relative speed of the aircraft. Set in meters per second.
Vertical velocity of the aircraft (can be negative, when expressing descending rate). Set in meters per second.

message.name: MISSION_CLEAR_ALL_EX
message.description: Delete all mission items at once.
message.field: System ID
Component ID

message.name: MISSION_COUNT_EX
message.description: This message is emitted as response to MISSION_REQUEST_LIST by the MAV and to initiate a write transaction. The GCS can then request the individual mission item based on the knowledge of the total number of MISSIONs.
message.field: System ID
Component ID
Number of mission items in the sequence

message.name: MISSION_ACK_EX
message.description: Ack message during MISSION handling. The type field states if this message is a positive ack (type=0) or if an error happened (type=non-zero).
message.field: System ID
Component ID
See MAV_MISSION_RESULT enum

message.name: TAIL_NUMBER_REQUEST
message.description: Request for tail number of the vehicle.
message.field: System ID
Component ID (not used)

message.name: TAIL_NUMBER_RESPONSE
message.description: Response with tail number of the vehicle.
message.field: Tail number of the vehicle.
See MAV_RESULT enum
